Title: Object: Study for the "Ecce Homo", Jerusalem
Series: Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841
Description: Pilate, a beared man in oriental dress, with a cloak slung over his left shoulder, sitting with right hand raised, looking to right, showing Jesus to the people, standing with a soldier and another man behind to left, after the scourging and dressed in purple and a crown of thorns, with a servant holding a basin and pitcher to Pilate's left, two women to his right, view of a city through a broad round arched bridge across a street behind to right. Hand-coloured lithograph printed in grey and beige
Curator's comments: From a set of lithographs 'Drawn on Stone by Joseph Nash', published in two volumes, London, 1843 and 1846 (1918,0205.2-8). See ODNB for Nash
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (379.21)
